sols_html:
By the mean value theorem, we have a constant c between 1 and 4 such that

\(\frac{f(4)-f(1)}{4-1} \leq f'(c) \leq -2\)

Cross multiplying yields

\(f(4)-f(1) \leq -2(4-1) = -6\)

Since \(f(1) = 3\), isolating for \(f(4)\) gives

\(f(4) \leq -6 + f(1) = -6+3 = -3\)

Thus the largest value \(f(4)\) can be is -3.
